definition: to cheer/to root for
to help/to assist
disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration

sentences.english: It gives people hope and I'm really happy to be here to support Jesse.
sentences.chinese: 它给人们带来希望，我很开心能到这来为杰西助阵。

sentences.english: And so on will also boost the morale of members as the "Nine" back.
sentences.chinese: 等也将作为助威团成员为“九连”助阵。

sentences.english: French estimates were that the Viet Minh had minimal artillery support, and France was bound to win.
sentences.chinese: 据法国估计，越盟几乎没有大炮助阵，法军胜券在握。

sentences.english: And he and actor Zhao Benshan perform during the concert.
sentences.chinese: 期间，演员赵本山也助阵朗朗的演奏会，雅俗共赏。

sentences.english: A shield before me is God who saves the honest heart.
sentences.chinese: 天主是我的护盾，给心正的人助阵。

definition: to cheer for/to encourage/to boost the morale of
to bring up the rear/to provide support/to hold the lines
jointly/as a group/together
to show oneself/to appear/(of a deity) to appear in the flesh
to cheer on (originally esp. as paid stooge)/to root for sb/to sing sb's praises/to flatter
to gather (in a crowd)/to converge/to swarm
old variant of 攜|携[xie2]
old variant of 攜|携[xie2]
to carry/to take along/to bring along/to hold (hands)/also pr. [xi1]
old variant of 攜|携[xie2]
(honorific) your kind efforts/thanks to your help
to invite/invitation/CL:個|个[ge4]
to do one's utmost
(of a commanding officer) to keep watch/to oversee
to assemble/to concentrate/to mass/to build up/to marshal
to add to the fun/to liven things up
esteemed guest/honored guest/guest (on a show)

to strike a pose (Chinese opera)/(fig.) to make a public appearance/to come out in public (revealing one's true personality, opinions etc)/(of a product) to appear on the market or at a trade show etc
to show up/present (at the scene)
